User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Freelancer Hub platform.

profileVerified.description: True if ID and credentials have passed verification.

Client.title: Client
Client.description: Represents a client managed by a freelancer.

freelancerUid.description: The UID of the freelancer who added this client. (Relationship: User 1:N Client)

isVerifiedClient.description: True if the client has completed a project and their identity is confirmed.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project managed by a freelancer for a client.

freelancerUid.description: The UID of the freelancer managing the project. (Relationship: User 1:N Project)

clientId.description: The ID of the associated client. (Relationship: Client 1:N Project)

milestones.description: Nested array for tracking project phases.

Referral.title: Referral
Referral.description: Represents a client referral to a freelancer for a new project.

clientId.description: The ID of the verified client making the referral. (Relationship: Client 1:N Referral)

referredFreelancerUid.description: The UID of the freelancer being referred to. (Relationship: User 1:N Referral)

projectDescription.description: Details of the new project being referred.

Proposal.title: Proposal
Proposal.description: Represents a proposal submitted by a freelancer for a project or competition.

freelancerUid.description: The UID of the freelancer submitting the proposal.

clientUid.description: The UID of the client who posted the project.

projectId.description: The ID of the project or competition being applied to.

projectName.description: The name of the project or competition.

bid.description: The bid amount for the proposal.

coverLetter.description: The cover letter submitted with the proposal.

submittedAt.description: The timestamp when the proposal was submitted.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Keyed by the user's unique Firebase Auth UID.

params.name: uid
params.description: The unique Firebase Auth UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores clients associated with a specific freelancer. Includes denormalized 'freelancerUid' for authorization independence.

params.name: freelancerUid
params.description: The UID of the freelancer who owns this client.

params.name: clientId
params.description: The unique ID of the client.

definition.description: Stores projects associated with a client of a freelancer. Includes denormalized 'freelancerUid' and 'clientId' for authorization independence.

params.name: freelancerUid
params.description: The UID of the freelancer managing the project.

params.name: clientId
params.description: The ID of the client associated with the project.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The unique ID of the project.

definition.description: Stores client referrals to freelancers. Includes 'clientId' and 'referredFreelancerUid' for authorization independence.

params.name: referralId
params.description: The unique ID of the referral.

definition.description: Stores all proposals submitted by freelancers for projects and competitions.

params.name: proposalId
params.description: The unique ID for the proposal.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure is designed to support the Freelancer Hub platform, focusing on user, client, project, referral and proposal management. It prioritizes authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User data is stored in `/users/{uid}`, client data in `/users/{freelancerUid}/clients/{clientId}`, project data in `/users/{freelancerUid}/clients/{clientId}/projects/{projectId}`, referral data in `/referrals/{referralId}`, and proposal data in `/proposals/{proposalId}`. Each entity is placed in separate collections to simplify security rules and avoid complex filtering.  Authorization independence is achieved by ensuring that each document contains all the information needed for authorization, eliminating the need for `get()` calls. For instance, the `Client` and `Project` collections are nested under the user's document to implicitly enforce ownership and simplify access control. The referral and proposal collections will contain the necessary UIDs to ensure each document stores the necessary information for authorization, enabling atomic operations and avoiding dependency on parent documents for access control. Segregation of data into separate collections based on ownership simplifies security rules and improves query performance. All paths follow a consistent naming convention for clarity and maintainability.
